thread.title: Chiefs RB Jamaal Charles out with knee injury
thread.title_full: Chiefs RB Jamaal Charles out with knee injury - UPI.com

author: upi.com
title: Chiefs RB Jamaal Charles out with knee injury
text:
KANSAS CITY -- Kansas City Chiefs running back Jamaal Charles went down with a right knee injury with just over nine minutes to play in the third quarter in Sunday's game against the Chicago Bears .
At the end of a running play up the middle, Charles was hit by linebacker Sam Acho and stopped for no gain. Charles stayed on the ground for several minutes and was eventually helped off the field by teammates. As he came off, he was unable to put any type of pressure on his right leg.
The Chiefs announced that Charles would not return to the game. Charcandrick West moved into Charles' role in the Chiefs offense.
Bears inside linebacker Shea McClellin left the field after the first play of the third quarter with what appeared to be an injury to his left leg.
McClellin made the tackle of Chiefs running back Jamaal Charles. As he went to the ground, a teammate tangled up with a Kansas City blocker and rolled into the linebacker's left knee. McClellin left the Bears' bench area on a cart and was taken to the locker room.
Outside linebacker LaRoy Reynolds was moved inside to take McClellin's spot.
  Chiefs place Jamaal Charles on IR Chiefs RB McKnight suffers torn Achilles Chiefs' Charles, Hali, Fasano miss practice Chiefs' Kolby Smith out for season
